The Bento Splat Charger shares its overall design with the Splat Charger. However, the ink tank of the Bento Splat Charger is metallic and black with grass nailed onto both sides, and the barrel changes color to match the user's ink.

The Bento Splat Charger is one of the nine weapons included in Sheldon's Picks Vol. 2, released on 8 June 2016. It comes in a set with Splash Walls and the Echolocator.

- The Bento Splat Charger is a middleweight weapon.

- Ink consumption scales from 2.4% to 18% depending on the charge level.
The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- The Bento Splat Charger cannot store its charge.

- It takes 1 second to fully charge the weapon.
When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

- Shots cannot pierce through enemies.

- When charging while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.2 units per frame.

- Damage scales from 40 to 100 depending on the charge level. At full charge, the damage is 160.

- Shot velocity scales from 12 to 35.29 units per frame depending on the charge level. At full charge, the velocity is 48 units per frame.

- Shot distance scales from 90 to 200 depending on the charge level. At full charge, the distance is 260.

- The full-charge ink consumption of 18% allows players to fire 5 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When charging a shot with an empty tank, the charge rate is 33.33%, permitting the player to fully charge a shot in 3 seconds.

The Bento Splat Charger features some weird green stuff I found washed up on a beach. I think it's cool. It's basically the same as the regular Splat Charger, but I've amped up the defense with a Splash Wall. The Echolocator makes this set perfect for caring souls who love to support their teammates.(NA)

- The tank of the Bento Splat Charger is a soy sauce bottle.

- The Bento Splat Charger is decorated with fake grass (baran) used to separate the different foods.

- Both this weapon and the Kelp Splat Charger were absent from Splatoon 2, likely in favor of the Firefin Splat Charger and Kensa Charger being the new second and third variants respectively for the Splat Charger.
Both remain absent from Splatoon 3, which features the Z+F Splat Charger and Splat Charger CAM-O as the second and third variants.
